content: Is there something like Finset that is suited to both proofs and computation (in particular has a defined ordering)? Was looking at RBSet, but I'm unsure if it has the same equality behavior (if you converted two permuted lists into an RBSet, would they always be equal?)
you could use sorted lists, or RBSet quotient by toList
I've never really seen a good reason to explicitly construct the quotient though, when reasoning about RBSet. Just state theorems with an appropriate relation instead of equality
